meanings.definition: The scheduled time for a performance or movie to begin.
meanings.sent1: The showtimes for the movie are 3:00 PM and 7:00 PM.
meanings.sent2: I always check the showtimes before deciding when to go to the theater.
meanings.sent3: The showtimes for the play were so early that even the actors were yawning.
meanings.sent4: The showtimes of life are unpredictable, like a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: Remembering the showtimes is crucial to avoid missing the start of the show.

meanings.definition: The times at which a particular event or activity is scheduled to take place.
meanings.sent1: The showtimes for the meeting are 9:00 AM and 2:00 PM.
meanings.sent2: She marked the showtimes of the soccer games on her calendar.
meanings.sent3: The showtimes for the party clashed with my dentist appointment.
meanings.sent4: In the showtimes of nature, the sunrise and sunset are the main attractions.
meanings.sent5: The showtimes for the event were carefully planned to accommodate all guests.
